title: Why it is important
content:
Coughs, colds, sore throats and runny noses are common in the lives of
children. Usually they are no cause for alarm.

In some cases, however, coughs are danger signs of more serious illnesses,
such as pneumonia or tuberculosis. Pneumonia is the world's leading cause of
death in girls and boys under age 5, closely followed by diarrhoea. Around 2
million children die from pneumonia every year. Pneumonia kills more children
than AIDS, malaria and measles combined. One out of every five deaths of
children under age 5 is caused by this respiratory infection.

All girls and boys have the right to quality health care to make sure that
respiratory infections and other illnesses are accurately diagnosed and
treated before it is too late.
